meanings.definition: Showing skill in achieving one's ends by deceit or evasion.
meanings.sent1: The fox was the cunningest animal in the forest, always outsmarting the other creatures.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the cunningest spy in the agency, able to gather information without anyone suspecting.
meanings.sent3: The cunningest magician in town could make coins disappear and reappear in the blink of an eye.
meanings.sent4: Her cunningest move was pretending to befriend her rival while secretly plotting to sabotage her.
meanings.sent5: The cunningest disguise he wore was that of a harmless old man, fooling everyone around him.

meanings.definition: Skillful or clever in a deceptive way.
meanings.sent1: The cunningest thief in the city could pick locks without making a sound.
meanings.sent2: He was the cunningest negotiator, always finding a way to get what he wanted.
meanings.sent3: The cunningest actor on stage could make the audience believe any role he played.
meanings.sent4: Her cunningest plan involved creating a diversion to distract the guards while she snuck past.
meanings.sent5: The cunningest disguise he wore was that of a harmless old man, fooling everyone around him.

meanings.definition: Attractive or quaint in a way that is striking or unusual.
meanings.sent1: The shop on the corner had the cunningest decorations, drawing in customers with its charm.
meanings.sent2: She wore the cunningest dress at the party, catching everyone's eye with its unique design.
meanings.sent3: The cunningest little cottage in the village was rumored to be home to a magical creature.
meanings.sent4: The cunningest flower in the garden bloomed only once a year, captivating all who saw it.
meanings.sent5: The cunningest smile she gave him made his heart skip a beat, its warmth undeniable.
